intro: Megalastrum aripense, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmate, with five to seven lobes, and it produces showy, pinkish-white flowers. The fruit, which resembles a star, is edible and has a sweet, tropical flavor.
